t: Luke 18
The Parable of the Persistent Widow
Then*p He spoke a parable to them, that men always ought to pray and not lose heart,
saying: “There*r was*r in*r a*r certain*r city*r a*r judge*r who*r did*r not*r fear*r God*r nor*r regard*r man.*r
Now*r there*r was*r a*r widow*r in*r that*r city;*r and*r she*r came*r to*r him,*r saying,*r ‘Get*r justice*r for*r me*r from*r my*r adversary.’*r
And*r he*r would*r not*r for*r a*r while;*r but*r afterward*r he*r said*r within*r himself,*r ‘Though*r I*r do*r not*r fear*r God*r nor*r regard*r man,*r
yet*r because*r this*r widow*r troubles*r me*r I*r will*r avenge*r her,*r lest*r by*r her*r continual*r coming*r she*r weary*r me.’”*r
Then*p the Lord said, “Hear*r what*r the*r unjust*r judge*r said.*r
And*r shall*r God*r not*r avenge*r His*r own*r elect*r who*r cry*r out*r day*r and*r night*r to*r Him,*r though*r He*r bears*r long*r with*r them?*r
I*r tell*r you*r that*r He*r will*r avenge*r them*r speedily.*r Nevertheless,*r when*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r comes,*r will*r He*r really*r find*r faith*r on*r the*r earth?”*r
The Parable of the Pharisee and the Tax Collector
Also*p He spoke this parable to some who trusted in themselves that they were righteous, and despised others:
“Two*r men*r went*r up*r to*r the*r temple*r to*r pray,*r one*r a*r Pharisee*r and*r the*r other*r a*r tax*r collector.*r

The*r Pharisee*r stood*r and*r prayed*r thus*r with*r himself,*r ‘God,*r I*r thank*r You*r that*r I*r am*r not*r like*r other*r men—extortioners,*r unjust,*r adulterers,*r or*r even*r as*r this*r tax*r collector.*r
I*r fast*r twice*r a*r week;*r I*r give*r tithes*r of*r all*r that*r I*r possess.’*r

And*r the*r tax*r collector,*r standing*r afar*r off,*r would*r not*r so*r much*r as*r raise*r his*ir eyes*r to*r heaven,*r but*r beat*r his*r breast,*r saying,*r ‘God,*r be*r merciful*r to*r me*r a*r sinner!’*r

I*r tell*r you,*r this*r man*r went*r down*r to*r his*r house*r justified*r rather*ir than*r the*r other;*r for*r everyone*r who*r exalts*r himself*r will*r be*r humbled,*r and*r he*r who*r humbles*r himself*r will*r be*r exalted.”*r
Jesus Blesses Little Children
Then*p they also brought infants to Him that He might touch them; but when the disciples saw it,*i they rebuked them.
But Jesus called them to Him*i and said, “Let*r the*r little*r children*r come*r to*r Me,*r and*r do*r not*r forbid*r them;*r for*r of*r such*r is*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.*r
Assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r whoever*r does*r not*r receive*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r as*r a*r little*r child*r will*r by*r no*r means*r enter*r it.”*r
Jesus Counsels the Rich Young Ruler
Now*p a certain ruler asked Him, saying, “Good Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?”
So*p Jesus said to him, “Why*r do*r you*r call*r Me*r good?*r No*r one*r is*ir good*r but*r One,*r that*ir is,*ir God.*r

You*r know*r the*r commandments:*r ‘Do*r not*r commit*r adultery,’*r ‘Do*r not*r murder,’*r ‘Do*r not*r steal,’*r ‘Do*r not*r bear*r false*r witness,’*r ‘Honor*r your*r father*r and*r your*r mother.’”*r
And*p he said, “All these things I have kept from my youth.”

So*p when Jesus heard these things, He said to him, “You*r still*r lack*r one*r thing.*r Sell*r all*r that*r you*r have*r and*r distribute*r to*r the*r poor,*r and*r you*r will*r have*r treasure*r in*r heaven;*r and*r come,*r follow*r Me.”*r
But*p when he heard this, he became very sorrowful, for he was very rich.
With God All Things Are Possible
And*p when Jesus saw that he became very sorrowful, He said, “How*r hard*r it*r is*r for*r those*r who*r have*r riches*r to*r enter*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God!*r
For*r it*r is*r easier*r for*r a*r camel*r to*r go*r through*r the*r eye*r of*r a*r needle*r than*r for*r a*r rich*r man*r to*r enter*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.”*r
And*p those who heard it said, “Who then can be saved?”
But*p He said, “The*r things*r which*r are*r impossible*r with*r men*r are*r possible*r with*r God.”*r
Then*p Peter said, “See, we have left all and followed You.”

So*p He said to them, “Assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r there*r is*r no*r one*r who*r has*r left*r house*r or*r parents*r or*r brothers*r or*r wife*r or*r children,*r for*r the*r sake*r of*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God,*r
who*r shall*r not*r receive*r many*r times*r more*r in*r this*r present*r time,*r and*r in*r the*r age*r to*r come*r eternal*r life.”*r
Jesus a Third Time Predicts His Death and Resurrection

Then*p He took the twelve aside and said to them, “Behold,*r we*r are*r going*r up*r to*r Jerusalem,*r and*r all*r things*r that*r are*r written*r by*r the*r prophets*r concerning*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r will*r be*r accomplished.*r
For*r He*r will*r be*r delivered*r to*r the*r Gentiles*r and*r will*r be*r mocked*r and*r insulted*r and*r spit*r upon.*r
They*r will*r scourge*r Him*ir and*r kill*r Him.*r And*r the*r third*r day*r He*r will*r rise*r again.”*r
But*p they understood none of these things; this saying was hidden from them, and they did not know the things which were spoken.
A Blind Man Receives His Sight
Then*p it happened, as He was coming near Jericho, that a certain blind man sat by the road begging.
And hearing a multitude passing by, he asked what it meant.
So they told him that Jesus of Nazareth was passing by.
And he cried out, saying, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
Then*p those who went before warned him that he should be quiet; but he cried out all the more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
So*p Jesus stood still and commanded him to be brought to Him. And when he had come near, He asked him,
saying, “What*r do*r you*r want*r Me*r to*r do*r for*r you?”*r He*p said, “Lord, that I may receive my sight.”
Then*p Jesus said to him, “Receive*r your*r sight;*r your*r faith*r has*r made*r you*r well.”*r
And immediately he received his sight, and followed Him, glorifying God. And all the people, when they saw it,*i gave praise to God.
